medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 7 days of age and included marked hyponatremia, hyperkalemia, and metabolic acidosis. Respiratory symptoms appeared after 1 month of age and were characterized by cough, chest congestion, fever, and wheezing, becoming less severe with age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a diagnosis of systemic pseudohypoaldosteronism type 1 (PHA1). Frequent hospital admissions for intravenous hydration were required until the age of 7 years.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was the only clinically affected member among his family; his elder sister was healthy.
